content.thinking: Let me carefully analyze this Colombian identification document to extract the required information following the methodology and rules provided. ## Document Structure Analysis - The document appears to be a "Cédula de Ciudadanía" from Colombia (clear header "REPUBLICA DE COLOMBIA" and "CEDULA DE CIUDADANIA") - This is an official government-issued identification document - The document is in Spanish - It has a photo, signature, and typical ID card layout - The document appears to have both front and back sides visible ## Field Extraction ### First Name (firstName) Looking for field labels like "NOMBRES:" I can see "JORGE EMILIO" under the word "NOMBRES" - This is the firstName. ### Last Name (lastName) Looking for field labels like "APELLIDOS:" I can see "MONTES MONTES" under the word "APELLIDOS" - This is the lastName. ### Country Issuer (country_issuer) The document header clearly states "REPUBLICA DE COLOMBIA" - The country_issuer is "Colombia". ### Nationality (nationality) There is no explicit nationality field visible, but following the hierarchy: 1. No explicit nationality field 2. Birth place appears to be "SINCELEJO (SUCRE)" based on info on the back of the card 3. Default to country_issuer: "Colombia" ### Identification Type (identificationType) The document title clearly states "CEDULA DE CIUDADANIA" - The identificationType is "Cédula de Ciudadanía". ### Identification Number (identificationNumber) I can see "6.820.960" prominently displayed - This is the identificationNumber. ### Additional Information - Birth date appears to be "05-SEP-1955" (visible on the back side) - Height: 1.73 m - Gender: M (Masculine) - Issue date appears to be "04-JUN-1977" in SINCELEJO - There's a fingerprint and barcode on the back side ## Final Validation All required fields have been clearly identified and can be extracted with high confidence. Now I'll format this into the required JSON:
